definition: a way out of a public building or vehicle
a place where vehicles can leave a road to join another road
an act of leaving, especially of an actor from the stage
the fact of leaving a particular situation or activity

to show something that previously could not be seen
to give somebody information that is supposed to be secret
having a beard
seeming natural, reasonable or sensible
following or able to follow the rules of logic in which ideas or facts are based on other true ideas or facts
willing to understand and respect other people’s behaviour, opinions, etc., especially when they are different from your own; believing people should be able to choose how they behave
having or relating to political and social beliefs that support individual freedom and rights, democracy and free enterprise (= businesses competing against each other with little government control)
following or supporting political policies that encourage social change and support the sharing of wealth more equally
connected with the British Liberal Party in the past, or a Liberal Party in another country
generous; given in large amounts
a liberal education is about increasing somebody’s general knowledge and experience rather than particular skills
not completely accurate or exact
in a literal way
used to emphasize the truth of something that may seem surprising
used to emphasize a word or phrase, even if it is not actually true in a literal sense
producing a large amount of money; making a large profit
that makes or is likely to make money
that gives somebody an advantage or a useful result
a person or thing that is not included in a general statement
a thing that does not follow a rule

people say that something is the exception that proves the rule when they are stating something that seems to be different from the normal situation, but they mean that the normal situation remains true in general
to allow somebody not to follow the usual rule on one occasion or for one particular reason
to object strongly to something; to be angry about something
except; not including
used to emphasize that the statement you are making is always true and everyone or everything is included
based on new ideas, forms or methods that are used to find out what effect they have
connected with scientific experiments
connected with beliefs and principles about what is right and wrong
morally correct or acceptable
unexpected, surprising or strange
not normal or ordinary; greater or better than usual
arranged for a special purpose and happening in addition to what normally or regularly happens
employed for a special purpose in addition to the usual staff
the act of trying to do something as well as somebody else because you admire them
the act of a computer or computer program working in the same way as another computer or program and performing the same tasks
the state of feeling or showing happiness and enthusiasm
something that you find exciting
the state of feeling sexual desire
a feeling of being very happy and excited
a person who has an important job as a manager of a company or an organization
a group of people who run a company or an organization
the part of a government responsible for putting laws into effect
the desk and computer at which a person works; one computer that is part of a computer network
a piece of paper or an electronic document on which there is a series of questions and exercises to be done by a student
a piece of paper or an electronic document on which work that has been done or has to be done is recorded
for which there is a fair and acceptable reason
allowed and acceptable according to the law
born when its parents are legally married to each other
born to parents who are not married to each other
not allowed by a particular set of rules or by law
a large sea fish with very sharp teeth and a pointed fin on its back. There are several types of shark, some of which can attack people swimming.
a person who is dishonest in business, especially somebody who gives bad advice and gets people to pay too much for something
(used especially about a television series, etc.) to include something that is very hard to believe as an attempt to keep people watching, usually a sign that the show is not as good as it used to be
the effect that somebody/something has on the way a person thinks or behaves or on the way that something works or develops
the power that somebody/something has to make somebody/something behave in a particular way
a person or thing that affects the way a person behaves and thinks
having had too much alcohol to drink
the system of wires that is used for carrying electricity around a building or machine
the connections of the brain or nervous system, especially when seen as causing behaviour that a person or animal has no control over
having a lot of money, possessions, etc.
people who are rich
flu
a serious disease caused by a virus, that causes a high temperature, severe pains and weakness
the process of showing, proving or recognizing who or what somebody/something is
the process of recognizing that something exists, or is important
official papers or a document that can prove who you are
a strong feeling of sympathy, understanding or support for somebody/something
the process of making a close connection between one person or thing and another
a person who has an official position
a fixed amount of food, fuel, etc. that you are officially allowed to have when there is not enough for everyone to have as much as they want, for example during a war
a fixed amount of food given regularly to a soldier or to somebody who is in a place where there is not much food available
an amount of something that is thought to be normal or fair
to make a feeling or situation exist
to mention or use a law, rule, etc. as a reason for doing something
to mention a person, a theory, an example, etc. to support your opinions or ideas, or as a reason for something
to mention somebody’s name to make people feel a particular thing or act in a particular way
to make a request (for help) to somebody, especially a god
to make somebody have a particular feeling or imagine a particular scene
to begin to run a program, etc.
to make evil appear by using magic
to stick to something
serious and very important; affecting the most central and important parts of something
central; forming the necessary basis of something
forming the source or base from which everything else is made; not able to be divided any further
a series of performances of music, plays, films, etc., usually organized in the same place once a year; a series of public events connected with a particular activity or idea
a day or period of the year when people stop working to celebrate a special event, often a religious one
connected with soldiers or the armed forces
a break in a bone or other hard material
the fact of something breaking, especially a bone

a business or service run under franchise
the right to vote in a country’s elections
a set of films in which the same characters appear in related stories
something that can be measured and used as a standard that other things can be compared with
to take a number or an amount away from another number or amount
intelligent, careful and showing good judgement, especially in business or politics

a person considered separately rather than as part of a group
a single member of a class of things
a person who is original and very different from others
a person of a particular type, especially a strange one
a remark or sign that shows that something is happening or what somebody is thinking or feeling
a symptom that suggests that particular medical treatment is necessary
freedom from political control by other countries
the time when a country gains freedom from political control by another country
the freedom to organize your own life, make your own decisions, etc. without needing help from other people
to take part in or become involved in an activity
having more than one meaning
to achieve something that you have been trying to do or get; to have the result or effect that was intended
to be successful in your job, earning money, power, respect, etc.
to come next after somebody/something and take their/its place or position
to gain the right to a title, property, etc. when somebody dies
when you are successful in one area of your life, it often leads to success in other areas
a shine on a smooth surface
a substance designed to make something shiny
paint which, when dry, has a hard shiny surface
an attractive appearance that is only on the surface and hides what is not so attractive
a way of explaining something to make it seem more attractive or acceptable
a note or comment added to a piece of writing to explain a difficult word or phrase

to cover something/somebody in material, for example in order to protect it/them
to put something around something/somebody
to cause a word or text to be carried over to a new line as the end of the previous line is reached by the writer; to be carried over in this way
to be so involved with somebody/something that you do not pay enough attention to other people or things
to persuade somebody to do anything that you want
to risk money on a card game, horse race, etc.
to risk losing something in the hope of being successful

a castle or a place that is strongly built and difficult to attack
an area where there are a large number of a particular type of animal
a very steep side of a high cliff, mountain or rock
involving two groups of people or two countries
involving both of two parts or sides of the body or brain
an extra amount of money that is added to a payment, especially to somebody’s wages or salary as a reward
anything pleasant that is extra and more or better than you were expecting
a small metal object that is fired from a gun
to start to deal with an unpleasant or difficult situation which cannot be avoided
to only just avoid getting hurt in a dangerous situation
a meeting in which people are given instructions or information
the detailed instructions or information that are given to people in a meeting that has been called in order to give these instructions
to make something continue at the same level, standard, etc.
to keep a building, a machine, etc. in good condition by checking or repairing it regularly
to support somebody/something over a long period of time by giving money, paying for food, etc.
to keep stating that something is true, even though other people do not agree or do not believe it

the seats that are nearest to the stage in a theatre
no longer used because something new has been invented
a painting, etc. that you do of yourself
deserving to be noticed or to receive attention; important

a word for a person with very low intelligence that is now considered offensive
behaviour that shows a lack of good sense or judgement
the designing, building and flying of aircraft
a possible effect or result of an action or a decision
something that is suggested or indirectly stated (= something that is implied)
the fact of being involved, or of involving somebody, in something, especially a crime
an extreme fear of being shut in a small place; the unpleasant feeling that a person gets in a situation that limits them
used after very and an adjective or adverb to emphasize a statement, description, etc.
used to emphasize a positive statement or answer
used to add information to a statement
used to show that you are surprised at something or that you find something silly
used when you are repeating a question that somebody has just asked and showing that you do not know the answer

used to say that a particular situation or fact is easy to see or understand
